Package org.jtrim2.collections

Class ArraysEx

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.collections.ArraysEx
public final class ArraysEx extends Object
Contains helper methods for arrays not present in Arrays.

This class cannot be instantiated or inherited.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final Object[]
    EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY
    An Object array with zero length, containing no elements.

  • Field Details

    • EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY

      public static final Object[] EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY
      An Object array with zero length, containing no elements. Since zero length arrays are immutable, this array can be used for better performance when an empty Object array is needed.

  • Method Details

    • viewAsList

      public static <T> List<T> viewAsList(T[] array, int offset, int length)
      Returns a readonly view of a part of an array. This method is equivalent to java.util.Arrays#asList(T...) except that the returned list cannot be modified.

      The elements of the returned list will reflect any changes done to the underlying array. The underlying array will not be copied; the returned list will retain a reference to the specified array. The returned list is serializable.

      Note that the returned list is also completely safe to use in multiple threads in any context if the underlying array does not change.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements of the array
      Parameters:
      array - the array to be viewed as a list. This argument cannot be null.
      offset - the starting index of the array. The element at this index will be the first element of the returned list (unless length is zero). This argument must be non-negative and not larger than the length of the specified array. The offset can be the same as the length of the specified array if and only if the specified length is zero. Note that the offset can never be larger than the length of the array.
      length - the number of elements to be used from the array. The returned list will have the same size as this length. This argument cannot be negative and (offset + length) must not be larger than the length of the specified array.
      Returns:
      a readonly list of the part of the specified array. This argument never returns null.
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - thrown if the offset and length specifies indexes outside of the specified array or if offset is larger than the length of the array.
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null

    • viewAsList

      public static <T> List<T> viewAsList(T[] array)
      Returns a readonly view of an array. This method is equivalent to java.util.Arrays#asList(T...) except that the returned list cannot be modified.

      The elements of the returned list will reflect any changes done to the underlying array. The underlying array will not be copied; the returned list will retain a reference to the specified array. The returned list is serializable.

      Note that the returned list is also completely safe to use in multiple threads in any context if the underlying array does not change.

      This method is equivalent to calling viewAsList(array, 0, array.length).

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements of the array
      Parameters:
      array - the array to be viewed as a list. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a readonly list of the part of the specified array. This argument never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null

    • findMax

      public static byte findMax(byte[] array)
      Returns the largest element of the specified array. The result of this method is unspecified if the underlying array changes during this method call.
      Parameters:
      array - the array in which the largest element is to be found. This argument cannot be null or empty.
      Returns:
      the largest element of the specified array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the array is empty
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null

    • findMax

      public static float findMax(float[] array)
      Returns the largest element of the specified array. The result of this method is unspecified if the underlying array changes during this method call.

      In case there can be multiple valid results any of them can be returned. If the array contains NaNs this method will only return NaN if the array only contains NaNs.

      Parameters:
      array - the array in which the largest element is to be found. This argument cannot be null or empty.
      Returns:
      the largest element of the specified array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the array is empty
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null

    • findMax

      public static double findMax(double[] array)
      Returns the largest element of the specified array. The result of this method is unspecified if the underlying array changes during this method call.

      In case there can be multiple valid results any of them can be returned. If the array contains NaNs this method will only return NaN if the array only contains NaNs.

      Parameters:
      array - the array in which the largest element is to be found. This argument cannot be null or empty.
      Returns:
      the largest element of the specified array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the array is empty
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null

    • findMax

      public static <T> T findMax(T[] array, Comparator<? super T> cmp)
      Returns the largest element of the specified array. The result of this method is unspecified if the underlying array changes during this method call. The order of the elements of the array is determined by the specified Comparator.

      In case there can be multiple valid results any of them can be returned.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements in the array
      Parameters:
      array - the array in which the largest element is to be found. This argument cannot be null or empty.
      cmp - the comparator to be used to determine which element is the largest. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the largest element of the specified array defined by the specified comparator
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the array is empty
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array or comparator is null. This exception can be thrown also if the array contains null values and the comparator does not permit null elements.

    • findMax

      public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> T findMax(T[] array)
      Returns the largest element of the specified array. The result of this method is unspecified if the underlying array changes during this method call. The order of the elements of the array is determined by the natural ordering the elements in the array.

      In case there can be multiple valid results any of them can be returned.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements in the array
      Parameters:
      array - the array in which the largest element is to be found. This argument cannot be null or empty.
      Returns:
      the largest element of the specified array defined by the specified comparator
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the array is empty
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null. This exception can be thrown also if the array contains null values.

      public static <T> T findMin(T[] array, Comparator<? super T> cmp)
      Returns the smallest element of the specified array. The result of this method is unspecified if the underlying array changes during this method call. The order of the elements of the array is determined by the specified Comparator.

      In case there can be multiple valid results any of them can be returned.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements in the array
      Parameters:
      array - the array in which the smallest element is to be found. This argument cannot be null or empty.
      cmp - the comparator to be used to determine which element is the largest. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the smallest element of the specified array defined by the specified comparator
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the array is empty
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array or comparator is null. This exception can be thrown also if the array contains null values and the comparator does not permit null elements.

      Returns the smallest element of the specified array. The result of this method is unspecified if the underlying array changes during this method call. The order of the elements of the array is determined by the natural ordering the elements in the array.

      In case there can be multiple valid results any of them can be returned.
